name: Yu Garden
description: 5-acre garden built in 1577 that features Ming dynasty pavilions, ponds, rockeries & arched bridges.

name: The Bund
tagline: Famed waterside walkway with city views
description: Historic, 1,500-meter-long waterside promenade showcasing distinctive modern & colonial buildings.

name: Oriental Pearl Tower
description: Futuristic TV tower (468-meters tall) offering city vistas, a history museum & revolving restaurant.

name: Nanjing Road
description: Nanjing Road is the main shopping street of Shanghai, China, and is one of the world's busiest shopping streets. The street is named after the city of Nanjing, capital of Jiangsu neighbouring

name: Shanghai Disney Resort
tagline: Walt Disney, The Lion King, and toy story
description: Shanghai Disney Resort is a themed resort in Pudong, Shanghai, China. It is the first Disney park resort in mainland China and the second in Greater China, after the Hong Kong Disneyland Resort

name: Jin Mao Tower
description: 88-story, spired skyscraper offering restaurants, offices, a Grand Hyatt hotel & observation deck.

name: Shanghai World Financial Center
description: One of the world's tallest skyscrapers, with 101 floors, an elevated hotel, views, shops & eateries.

name: Shanghai Tower
description: 632-m. megatall skyscraper with 2 observation decks, plus restaurants, bars, shops & a hotel.

name: City God Temple of Shanghai
description: In a bustling shopping district, this large, restored temple complex dates back to the 15th century.

name: Shanghai Museum
description: Huge, free museum with extensive displays including bronze & jade artifacts, sculptures & paintings.

name: Jade Buddha Temple
description: Active Buddhist temple known for its large, ornate jade Buddha sculptures.

name: Waitan
description: Waterfront Waitan, also called the Bund, is Shanghai’s heart, with restored colonial buildings housing luxe nightclubs and cocktail bars. Big-name global chefs provide fine dining, and Nanjing

name: Tianzifang
tagline: Historic neighborhood with an artsy vibe
description: This former French Concession area with narrow alleys is known for its quaint shops, cafes & bars.

name: New World
description: New World, also known as Xintiandi, is a fashionable area with upscale shopping and nightlife venues in restored stone-gate (shikumen) buildings. The pedestrianized streets are home to flagship

name: People's Square
description: People’s Square is a major transport hub that draws visitors to Nanjing West Road, a main shopping street with malls offering local fashion and electronics, and food stalls selling kebabs and

name: Huaihai Road
description: Huaihai Road or Huaihai Lu is one of the two major shopping streets in Shanghai, China; the other is Nanjing Road. Compared with the more touristy Nanjing Road, Huaihai Road is more upscale,

name: Shanghai Ocean Aquarium
tagline: Seals, sharks & water dragons on display
description: Contemporary aquarium with local & exotic marine life & long, glass-enclosed underwater walkways.

name: 50 Moganshan Road
tagline: Popular area for art galleries & studios
description: Celebrated contemporary district featuring a diverse selection of art galleries & studio spaces.

name: Jing'an Temple
description: Historic Buddhist temple complex comprising 3 main halls & a massive sitting jade Buddha.

name: People's Park
tagline: Public green space with lawns & a pond
description: Set amid skyscrapers, this urban park offers landscaped lawns & wooded areas, plus a pond & cafe.

name: Fuxing Park
tagline: City park with fountain & walking trails
description: French colonial–era green space with a tranquil fountain & ponds, plus walking trails & gardens.

name: Suzhou Creek
description: Suzhou Creek, also called Wusong River, is a river that passes through the Shanghai city center. It is named after the neighbouring city of Suzhou, Jiangsu, the predominant settlement in this

name: Waibaidu Bridge
tagline: Iconic all-steel bridge with LED lights
description: This landmark is China's first all-steel bridge & features a colorful LED lighting system.

name: Shanghai Urban Planning Exhibition Center
description: Modern 6-story space offering interactive exhibits on the city's architecture & urban development.

name: Shanghai Science and Technology Museum
description: Modern museum focusing on technology, with educational programs, multimedia exhibits & theaters.

name: China Art Museum
description: Free museum featuring modern & contemporary works by Chinese artists in a 2010 World Expo pavilion.

name: Longhua Temple
description: This reconstructed 3rd-century Buddhist temple features towers, a library & a traditional garden.

name: Shanghai Art Museum
tagline: Art museum, museum, art, and modern art
description: The Shanghai Art Museum was an art museum in the city of Shanghai, China. In October 2012, the museum was rebranded as the China Art Museum when it moved to the China pavilion at Expo 2010 on

name: Shanghai Natural History Museum
description: Exhibits on human civilization's history & animals, including ancient species such as dinosaurs.

name: Shanghai History Museum
tagline: The city's past in photos & artifacts
description: Art, artifacts, documents & photos illustrating the history of Shanghai, with rotating exhibits.

name: Xujiahui
description: Bustling Xujiahui is a commercial district known for its large malls, sometimes including multiplex cinemas and chain restaurants. Specialist shopping hubs include Grand Gateway 66, for international

name: Huangpu Park
description: China's first European-style public park, founded in 1886, now home to a memorial & history museum.

name: Lupu Bridge
tagline: The Lupu Bridge, named after Luwan District, is a through arch bridge over the Huangpu River in Shanghai, China, connecting the city's Huangpu and Pudong districts. It is the world's second longest

name: Museum of Contemporary Art Shanghai
tagline: Contemporary art in a former greenhouse
description: Established in 2005, this museum exhibits works of contemporary art in former greenhouse.

name: Lu Xun Park
tagline: Recreational area with a notable grave
description: Tree-filled recreational park with a manmade lake & the tomb of Lu Xun, a famous Chinese writer.

name: St. Ignatius Cathedral
description: Restored Neo-Gothic Roman Catholic church with stained glass featuring Chinese characters & icons.

name: Shanghai New International Expo Center
description: The Shanghai New International Expo Centre is an exhibition center in Pudong, Shanghai, China. It hosts a large number of exhibitions, including the Shanghai Motor Show. It has also hosted the

name: Dianshan Lake
description: Dianshan Lake is a freshwater lake west of Zhujiajiao, Qingpu, in the Shanghai municipality of China. It is upstream of the Huangpu River.

name: Gongqing Forest Park
tagline: Vast city park & popular BBQ spot
description: Sprawling urban park with picnic & BBQ facilities, plus a kids' playground & boat rentals.

name: Former Residence of Sun Yat-Sen
tagline: Former home of revolutionary Sun Yat-sen
description: This house, where revolutionary Sun Yat-sen lived from 1918 to his death, has artifacts & a statue.

name: Confucian Temple of Shanghai
description: Rebuilt temple complex honoring Confucius, with pavilions, a towering pagoda, sculptures & gardens.

name: Madame Tussauds Shanghai
description: Museum chain for life-size wax replicas of famous Americans & historic icons in themed galleries.

name: Zhongshan Park
description: Serene park featuring a lush array of plantings, including roses & lotus flowers.

name: Rockbund Art Museum
tagline: Contemporary art museum with a cafe
description: Museum with current Chinese & international works, with a cafe, library & educational programs.

name: Sightseeing Hall, F88, Shanghai Jinmao Tower
